marketNews.title: Adaro Group Performance 1H25: AADI Exceeds Expectations, ADRO Below Expectations
marketNews.content: Adaro Group issuers, namely Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI) and Alamtri Resources Indonesia ($ADRO), have released their financial reports for the 2Q25 period. Here is a summary from us: AADI 1H25: Net Profit -50% YoY, Exceeds Expectations. AADI recorded a net profit of 233 million US dollars in 2Q25 (+19% QoQ, -60% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 429 million US dollars (-50% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 57% of the 2025F consensus estimate, thanks to a fairly resilient gross profit margin and efficient opex. 1. Revenue increase +6.1% QoQ - The revenue increase in 2Q25 was caused by a sales volume increase of +7.3% QoQ to the level of 17.58 million tons, while the average selling price (ASP) decreased by -1.3% QoQ to 67 US dollars per ton. 2. Net profit margin improvement to 18.8% - AADI recorded a net profit margin increase of +200 bps QoQ to 18.8% in 2Q25, primarily driven by the reversal of other losses: from a loss of 5 million US dollars in 1Q25 to a profit of 28 million US dollars in 2Q25. 3. Fairly resilient gross profit - AADI's gross profit still grew +0.2% QoQ in 2Q25 amidst a decrease in ASP. This gross profit growth was driven by more moderate growth in the cost of revenue, mainly due to a royalty expense decrease of -22% QoQ as a result of a lower royalty tariff determination for IUPK license holders by the government. 4. Production increase and stripping ratio - Operationally, AADI recorded an increase in production volume and stripping ratio. Production volume in 2Q25 rose +9% QoQ to 17.5 million tons, while the stripping ratio stood at 4.3x (vs. 1Q25: 3.2x). ADRO 1H25: Net Profit -78% YoY, Below Expectations. ADRO recorded a net profit of 98 million US dollars in 2Q25 (+28% QoQ, -76% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 175 million US dollars (-78% YoY), below expectations (39% of 2025F consensus estimate), due to the weak performance in 1Q25 despite performance improvements in 2Q25. 1. Revenue increase +25% QoQ, supported by the mining services segment - ADRO recorded revenue of 476 million US dollars in 2Q25 (+25% QoQ). Segmentally, revenue from the metallurgical coal segment grew +23% QoQ, while revenue from the mining services segment grew +32% QoQ. Metallurgical coal segment revenue was supported by a +25% QoQ increase in metallurgical coal sales volume amidst a -7% QoQ decrease in ASP. 2. Operating profit margin increase +950 bps QoQ - The operating profit margin increase to 30.3% in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: 20.8%) was driven by more moderate growth in the cost of revenue (+11.4% QoQ) and a -4.4% QoQ decrease in opex. 3. Production increase and decrease in stripping ratio - Operationally, ADRO experienced an increase in metallurgical coal production volume of +18.2% QoQ to 1.88 million tons. Meanwhile, the stripping ratio was recorded at a decrease to 3.3x (vs. 1Q25: 3.55x). Key Takeaway: We assess that AADI has the potential to continue its positive performance momentum in 2H25, driven by higher sales volume compared to the 1H25 realization. AADI management targets sales volume around 65-67 million tons throughout 2025, implying -1.2% YoY to +1.8% YoY compared to the 2024 realization. Coal prices themselves have recently been on an upward trend, so the ASP in 3Q25 has the potential to be better than the 2Q25 realization. From the cost side, AADI's performance will be more efficient in line with the setting of lower new royalty rates for IUPK permit holders as of 2Q25. Meanwhile, for ADRO, achieving performance against the 2025F consensus expectation is relatively more challenging given the performance realization during 1H25. In today\'s trading, Monday (1/9), AADI closed stronger +2.17%, while ADRO fell -1.99%.

marketNews.title: Other things that are hot that you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, on Sunday (31/8) denied rumors of the resignation of the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, from her cabinet position. Airlangga explained that Sri Mulyani attended the cabinet meeting agenda at the Presidential Palace complex, Jakarta, on Sunday (31/8). Antara reported that Airlangga's clarification came after Sri Mulyani was again rumored to be resigning from her position. 2. BPS recorded that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in Indonesia reached 2.31% YoY in August 2025 (vs. July 2025: 2.37% YoY inflation). Monthly, the CPI experienced deflation of 0.08% MoM (vs. July 2025: 0.3% MoM inflation). Expenditure groups driving inflation were 'food, beverages, and tobacco' and jewelry gold with contributions of 1.14 percentage point and 0.45 percentage point, respectively. Meanwhile, core inflation in August 2025 reached 0.06% MoM and 2.17% YoY. 3. S&P Global noted that Indonesia's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.5 in August 2025 (vs. July 2025: 49.2), marking the highest level since March 2025 as well as the first expansion of factory activity in the last 5 months. Factory activity recovered along with output and new orders increases after contracting for 4 consecutive months, while foreign demand rose at the fastest pace since September 2023. Employment slightly increased, ending a three-month streak of employment contraction. Business sentiment also improved along with expectations for stronger demand, new product launches, and increasing consumer purchasing power. 4. BPS recorded that Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 4.18 billion US dollars in July 2025 (vs. July 2024: 5.01 billion US dollars surplus, June 2025: 4.11 billion US dollars surplus), as exports grew +9.86% YoY and imports fell -5.86% YoY. Over 7M25, Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 23.65 billion US dollars (vs. 7M24: 15.92 billion US dollars), with exports and imports rising +8.03% YoY and +3.41% YoY, respectively. 5. US economic analysis bureau noted that the core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index in the US rose 0.3% MoM in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 0.3% MoM), in line with consensus expectations. Annually, the core PCE index rose 2.9% YoY, in line with consensus expectations and marking the highest level in the last 5 months. The core PCE index is data viewed by the Fed to measure inflation progress against the 2% target level. 6. Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal ($IPCC) recorded vehicle cargo handling of 641,746 units during 7M25 (+12.3% YoY). Meanwhile, truck or bus cargo handling was 111,946 units (+24.4% YoY) and heavy equipment cargo handling was 18,588 units (+34.3% YoY). Ship calls to IPCC managed docks also increased to 1,834 calls (+13.1% YoY). 7. Wir Asia ($WIRG) controller, PT WIR Global Kreatif, sold 31 million WIRG shares at an average price of 209 rupiah per share on August 27, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~6.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership stake of PT WIR Global Kreatif in WIRG decreased from 10.002% to 9.742%. 8. President Prabowo Subianto in a joint statement with political party general chairmen on Sunday (31/8) stated that he would eliminate the allowance amount for DPR RI members and implement a moratorium on working visits abroad. This step emerged as a response to public aspirations regarding dynamics of demonstrations in various regions. President Prabowo also emphasized that the DPR RI will soon open a direct dialogue space with the public. 9. BPS recorded that foreign tourist visits to Indonesia reached ~1.5 million people in July 2025 (+13% YoY, +4.6% MoM). This result brought the cumulative foreign tourist visits for 7M25 to grow +10% YoY to ~8.5 million people, equivalent to 53-61% of the government's 2025 target in the range of 14-16 million people.

tickerNews.title: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang 1H25 Net Profit +203% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang recorded a net profit of 2.6 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+96% QoQ, +20% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 4.7 trillion rupiah (+203% YoY), exceeding expectations (67% of 2025F consensus estimate). The quarterly net profit increase in 2Q25 was driven by a revenue increase (+126% QoQ) and an operating profit margin expansion to 10.5% (vs. 1Q25: 7%). Nevertheless, outside of operational activities, ANTM experienced a reversal in foreign exchange gain from a profit of 328 billion rupiah in 1Q25 to a loss of 98 billion rupiah in 2Q25, causing the net profit margin in 2Q25 to drop to 7.8% (vs. 1Q25: 9%).

tickerNews.title: $BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia July 2025 Bank-Only Net Profit Rp 1.7 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia recorded a bank-only net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah in July 2025 (-11% YoY, +3% MoM). This result brought the bank-only net profit for 7M25 to 11.9 trillion rupiah (-5% YoY), equivalent to 56.4% of the 2025F consolidated estimate from consensus (vs. 7M24: 58.3% consolidation realization for 2024). The annual net profit decline in July 2025 was caused by weak Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) which decreased by -10% YoY along with a Net Interest Income decline of -8% YoY. Meanwhile, the net profit decline over 7M25 was driven by: 1) weakening PPOP (-3% YoY) due to an opex increase of +6% YoY; and 2) an increase in provision expense of +6% YoY. Loan growth was recorded at +6% YoY as of July 2025.

tickerNews.title: $LINK: Axiata Investments (Indonesia) Sdn. Bhd. Sold Shares
tickerNews.content: $LINK: Link Net's controller, Axiata Investments (Indonesia) Sdn. Bhd., sold ~136.2 million LINK shares on August 26, 2025, at a price of 3,060 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached ~417 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of Axiata Investments (Indonesia) Sdn. Bhd. in LINK decreased from 75.42% to 70.66%.

tickerNews.title: $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara 1H25 Net Profit Rp 144 Million, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara recorded a net profit of 82 million US dollars in 2Q25 (+26% YoY, +33% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 144 million US dollars (-23% YoY), below expectations (44% of 2025F consensus estimate). The annual net profit increase in 2Q25 was due to the recovery of a write-off on receivables amounting to 0.6 million US dollars (vs. 2Q24: loss of 24.9 million US dollars). Operationally, operating profit was recorded at 136 million US dollars in 2Q25 (-6% YoY, +34% QoQ) due to an operating expense increase (+14% YoY, -4% QoQ) higher than revenue (+9% YoY, +0% QoQ). This resulted in an operating profit for 1H25 recorded at 238 million US dollars (-25% YoY), slightly below expectations (48% of 2025F consensus estimate).

tickerNews.title: $BUMI: UBS Group AG increased ownership stake
tickerNews.content: $BUMI: UBS Group AG announced it had purchased ~91 million Bumi Resources shares on August 25, 2025, at a price of approximately 112 rupiah per share or a total value of ~10.2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, UBS Group AG's ownership in BUMI increased from 6.98% to 7.01%. UBS Group AG explained that this transaction was intended for client derivative hedging activities.
